Pharmacogenetic testing through the direct-to-consumer genetic testing company 23andMe.

Direct-to-consumer (DTC) genetic testing companies, such as 23andMe, allow consumers to access their genetic information directly through an online service without the involvement of healthcare professionals.

PURPOSE

23andMe is back on the market as the first direct-to-consumer genetic testing company that "includes reports that meet Food and Drug Administration (FDA) standards…."
The case of 23andMe online genetic testing platform.

Direct-to-consumer ( DTC ) genetic testing companies , such as 23andMe , allow consumers to access their genetic information directly through an online service without the involvement of healthcare professionals .

The past year has been marked by the emergence of several companies , such as 23andMe , deCODEME , Navigenics and Knome , offering tests using genome-wide technology direct to consumers over the internet.

More recently , it placed burdensome restrictions on direct-to-consumer ( DTC ) genetic testing companies , such as 23andMe , based on fears that consumers would make irrational medical decisions after receiving genetic variant results .
